intro: Thelycrania rugosa, commonly known as the rough thelycrania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in dry, rocky habitats. It has a taproot system that allows it to survive in arid conditions. The plant is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and delicate blooms.
